jarvis.vasp package¶

Submodules¶

jarvis.vasp.joptb88vdw module¶

Module to run OptB88vdW based High-throughput calculations

Geting Kpoints object from structure and line-density :param mat: Poscar object with structure information :param length: line-density

Returns:Kpoint object
Return type:kpp

jarvis.vasp.joptb88vdw.get_lowest_en_from_mp(formula, MAPI_KEY='', all_structs=False)[source]¶

Lowest energy/chemical potential of an element from the materialsproject/jarvis database. Note: Get the api key from materialsproject/jarvis website. :param formula: say Al, Ni etc. :param MAPI_KEY: should be defines in the environment :param all_structs: all structures or just stable ones (True/False)

Returns:energy per atom
Return type:enp
jarvis.vasp.joptb88vdw.main_func(mpid='', jid='', mat=None, enforc_cvn=False)[source]¶

Main function to carry out property calculations :param mpid: materialsproject id :param jid: jarvis-dft id :param mat: Poscar object :param enforc_cvn: whether or not enforce conventional cell input structure

Returns:final energy final: final structure
Return type:en
jarvis.vasp.joptb88vdw.make_big(poscar=None, size=11.0)[source]¶

Helper function to make supercell :param poscar: Poscar object :param size: simulation size in Angstrom

Returns:Poscar supercell object
Return type:big
jarvis.vasp.joptb88vdw.run_job(mat=None, incar=None, kpoints=None, jobname='', copy_file=[])[source]¶

Generic function to run a VASP job, error correction implemented using custodian package A jobname+.json file is produced after successful completion of the job A first_cust.py file is generated which is invoked using python command :param mat: Poscar object with structure information :param incar: Incar object with control information :param kpoints: Kpoints object with mesh information :param jobname: a uniq name for a job-type, say MAIN-ELAST for elastic properties :param copy_file: copy file from previous runs, say CHGCAR for Non-SCF bandstructure calculations

Returns:final energy contcar: path to final relaxed structure
Return type:f_energy
jarvis.vasp.joptb88vdw.smart_converge(mat=None, encut='', leng='', band_str=True, elast_prop=True, optical_prop=True, mbj_prop=True, spin_orb=False, phonon=False, surf_en=False, def_en=False)[source]¶

Main function to converge k-points/cut-off optimize structure, and run subsequent property calculations :param mat: Poscar object with structure information :param encut: if ‘’ then automataic convergence, else use defined fixed-cutoff :param leng: if ‘’ then automataic convergence, else use defined fixed-line density :param band_str: if True then do band-structure calculations along high-symmetry points :param elast_prop: if True then do elastic property calculations using finite-difference :param optical_prop: if True do frequency dependent dielectric function calculations using he independent-particle (IP) approximation :param mbj_prop: if True do METAGGA-TBmBJ optical property calculations with IP approximation :param spin_orb: if True do spin-orbit calculations :param phonon: if True do phonon calculations using DFPT :param surf_en: if True do surface enrgy calculations :param def_en: if True do defect enrgy calculations

Returns:final energy mat_f: final structure
Return type:en2
jarvis.vasp.joptb88vdw.smart_surf(strt=None, tol=0.1)[source]¶

Umbrell function for surface energies with convergence :param strt: Structure object :param tol: surface energy convergence tolerance in eV

Returns:list of surface energies surf_header_list: list of surface names
Return type:surf_list

jarvis.vasp.joptb88vdw.use_incar_dict = {'AGGAC': 0.0, 'EDIFF': '1E-7', 'GGA': 'BO', 'IBRION': 2, 'ISIF': 2, 'ISMEAR': 0, 'LCHARG': '.FALSE.', 'LUSE_VDW': '.TRUE.', 'LWAVE': '.FALSE.', 'NELM': 400, 'NPAR': 4.898979485566356, 'NSW': 1, 'PARAM1': 0.1833333333, 'PARAM2': 0.22, 'PREC': 'Accurate'}¶

Change use_incar_dict based on a functional, examples given for LDA and PBE

functional=’LDA’ ldadict = dict(

PREC = ‘Accurate’, ISMEAR = 0, IBRION=2,

EDIFF = ‘1E-7’, NSW = 1, NELM = 400, ISIF = 2, NPAR = np.sqrt(ncores), LCHARG = ‘.FALSE.’, LWAVE = ‘.FALSE.’ )

use_incar_dict=ldadict

functional=’PBE’ pbedict = dict(

PREC = ‘Accurate’, ISMEAR = 0, IBRION=2,

GGA = ‘PE’,

EDIFF = ‘1E-7’, NSW = 1, NELM = 400, ISIF = 2, NPAR = np.sqrt(ncores), LCHARG = ‘.FALSE.’, LWAVE = ‘.FALSE.’ )

use_incar_dict=pbedict

Module contents¶

Module to run DFT particularly VASP calculations with JARVIS-DFT
